<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/10/tsa-reports-passengers-guns-airports?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hello Travel My Old Friend
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Cruises and airlines" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDQwL2NydWlzZXNfYW5kX2FpcmxpbmVzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Travel is light years away from pre-pandemic levels, but it is slowly creeping back. Here's the latest: </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">1. Planes</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tom Hanks finally has some company—U.S. airports are the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/10/airline-shares-surge-as-tsa-numbers-hit-pandemic-high-support-for-second-bailout-builds.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">busiest</a> they've been in five months. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, TSA said it screened nearly 832,000 people at airport checkpoints on Sunday, the first time screenings have topped 800k since March 17. Air passenger levels remain around 70% lower than a year ago, however.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Airline execs have become full-time C-SPAN viewers. If Congress ever passes another COVID-19 relief bill, it could include more bailout funds for the industry.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trend watching: </strong>TSA said it's finding guns in passenger carry-ons at <a href="https://apnews.com/946144114ed44e83ba12858cba2334cd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">3x the pace</a> it was at this time last year. And 80% of those guns were loaded.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">2. Hotels</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"We see folks are increasingly willing to step out and travel," Marriott CEO Arne Sorenson said during his company's <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/marriott-swings-to-2q-loss-cites-recovery-11597059791?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Q2 earnings report</a>, aka "the worst quarter we have ever seen by far." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But by definition "worst" means "can only get better." 91% of Marriott's global properties are now open, with Greater China leading the charge. Sorenson said that region's success is an example of what can happen if places successfully control the spread of the virus. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trend watching: </strong>In terms of pace of recovery, leisure travel > corporate travel, Sorenson said.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">3. Cruises</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They say be your own best advocate, and Royal Caribbean execs are a shining example. CEO Richard Fain said the company was "<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/10/royal-caribbean-stock-jumps-as-executives-tout-remarkable-demand-for-2021-cruises.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">humbled and surprised</a>" with 2021 bookings despite "literally no marketing efforts." He said people were frustrated with staying at home and desperately wanted a vacation.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The entire cruise industry has effectively been shut down since the pandemic gained steam in March. Royal Caribbean was forced to </span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/cruises/2020/08/10/royal-caribbean-cruises-likely-have-covid-19-testing-upon-return/3302471001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cancel</a></span><span> more than 1,500 sailings and booked a $1.3 billion loss last quarter.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trend watching: </strong>Expect Royal Caribbean cruises to begin in Australia and China first, potentially before November. It all depends on the trajectory of the virus. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LEGAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/10/mcdonalds-sues-former-ceo-steve-easterbrook-new-allegations-sexual-misconduct-surface?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Sex, Lies, and a Side of Fries
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS - DECEMBER 11, 2018:  A McDonald's fast food restaura..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDQxL2Zhc3RfZm9vZF9yZXN0YXVyYW50cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Robert Alexander/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In November of 2019, McDonald’s fired then CEO Steve Easterbrook for <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/03/mcdonalds-steve-easterbrook-is-out-as-ceo-due-to-a-consensual-relationship-with-an-employee.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sexting with a subordinate</a>, a relationship deemed consensual but inappropriate. The company quietly moved on and that seemed to be the end of it.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Narrator: It wasn’t</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, McDonald’s capped off a subsequent investigation and <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/10/business/mcdonalds-steve-easterbrook-ceo-lawsuit/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brought a lawsuit against Easterbrook</a>, accusing him of lying to the board of directors about the extent of his relationships with employees. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The kicker:</strong></span><span> The company is </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/10/business/mcdonalds-ceo-steve-easterbrook.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trying to recover</a></span><span> $40 million from Easterbrook—about the amount of his exit package.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Easterbrook, who launched all-day breakfast and helped double McDonald’s share price during his time as CEO, is also alleged to have given an employee he was having a relationship with generous stock options.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> It’s not often you see a scandal like this play out in public, but McDonald’s has chosen to face Easterbrook’s alleged transgressions head-on. The company is facing <a href="https://www.thenation.com/article/society/mcdonalds-sexual-harassment-feature/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lots of other accusations</a> of sexual harassment at the workplace—those it may try to keep out of the spotlight. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/10/simon-property-group-reportedly-talks-amazon-turn-mall-spaces-logistics-centers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Auntie Anne’s Might Be Getting a New Neighbor
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="WASHINGTON, D.C., Aug. 7, 2020 -- A reopening shopping mall is seen in W..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDQyL3Vfc18td2FzaGluZ3Rvbl9kX2NfLXVuZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Xinhua News Agency/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the country’s largest mall landlord Simon Property Group reported earnings. You know what’s next. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Revenue declined 24% to $1.1 billion. To put some of the punches in perspective...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Rent: </strong></span><span>Simon </span><span><a href="https://investors.simon.com/news-releases/news-release-details/simon-property-group-reports-second-quarter-2020-results?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collected</a></span><span> 51% of the rent it was due in April and May in the U.S. Rent payments rebounded to ~70% in June and July.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">COVID-19 closures:</strong></span><span> Simon’s U.S. retail properties lost a total 10,500 shopping days in Q2. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Simon’s been steadily reopening locations since lockdowns eased in May. As of Friday, 91% of its U.S. tenants were open and operating.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That’s not what got investors excited </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sunday, the WSJ reported Simon is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-and-giant-mall-operator-look-at-turning-sears-j-c-penney-stores-into-fulfillment-centers-11596992863?mod=e2tw&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in talks</a> with Amazon to turn some mall properties occupied by struggling retailers like JCPenney and Sears into fulfillment centers. Why does that make sense?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Simon</strong></span><span> gets a reliable tenant that definitely has money to make rent.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Amazon </strong></span><span>gets more distribution centers across America to make good on its lightning-quick delivery promises.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> The collapse of brick-and-mortar shopping chains was called the “retail apocalypse” before COVID-19 hit. Mall owners have to get creative to stay alive, and e-commerce might be the answer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ For more retail news and analysis...</strong>sign up for the fantastic <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=inline&utm_campaign=link&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Retail Brew</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s the most valuable asset in the world?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gold? <em>Nope.</em> Tesla stock? <em>Not until you-know-who stops tweeting.</em> A penthouse overlooking Central Park? <em>Close, but no cigar.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s art. When a single painting can (quite literally) sell for hundreds of millions of dollars, it’s no wonder that art is one of the most sought-after asset classes for improving portfolio performance (yep, even now).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the $1.7T art market has two huge problems:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. Lack of data transparency<br>2. Incredibly high barrier to entry</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So what do you call it when one startup manages to solve both? <strong style="color:#000">We call it a great freaking opportunity.</strong> </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meet <a href="https://www.masterworks.io/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=primary&utm_campaign=newsletter_8-11-20&utm_term=Brew%20Subscribers&utm_content=newsletter" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Masterworks</a>, the exclusive platform that lets you <strong style="color:#000">buy shares of great works by Kaws, Banksy, and more</strong>. The brainchild of serial tech entrepreneurs (who also happen to be top-100 art collectors), they make investing easier than getting upvotes on /r/wallstreetbets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Run, don’t walk<em>: </em>Brew readers can <a href="https://www.masterworks.io/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=primary&utm_campaign=newsletter_8-11-20&utm_term=Brew%20Subscribers&utm_content=newsletter" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skip the waitlist</a>.*</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/10/barry-dillers-iac-buys-12-stake-mgm-resorts?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Billionaire Barry Bets on Better Betting
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Casino reopening" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDQ0L2Nhc2lub19yZW9wZW5pbmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While everyone was busy gambling on Ukrainian ping pong and Hertz stock, billionaire media mogul Barry Diller's IAC group was lining up a bet...on betting. Yesterday, IAC revealed a <a href="https://skift.com/2020/08/10/barry-dillers-iac-takes-1-billion-stake-in-mgm-resorts-with-eye-on-online-gaming/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">12% stake</a> in casino operator MGM Resorts worth an estimated $1 billion.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">To Diller, MGM = Disney</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a letter to investors, Diller compared MGM—which operates Vegas casinos like the Bellagio and Mirage—to Disney for <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/a799a5e8-0c72-4214-b08d-cc6d3e01c5bd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">its ability</a> to use its "iconic brand and multiple avenues to monetize the same intellectual property." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One monetization avenue that most interests IAC is MGM's inroads in online gaming, which includes sports betting platform BetMGM. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It's only live in seven states so far due to restrictions on gambling, but Diller thinks that the regulatory environment will "generally catch up with consumer demand," putting IAC in a position to profit when it does. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out</strong>: The pandemic crippled the casino business, and revenue at MGM, which operates more than 35% of rooms on the Vegas strip, fell 91% in Q2. But if IAC's hunch is correct, there's a path to recovery for gaming companies—and it's through diversifying physical assets with more online offerings.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/10/nycs-mta-asks-apple-make-simpler-phone-unlock-masked-users?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mask vs. Phone Not a Fair Fight
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Masked riders on the subway " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDM5L21hc2tlZF9yaWRlcnNfb25fdGhlX3N1YndheS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gary Hershorn/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The country's largest public transit authority, New York City’s MTA, has a problem: Riders are taking off their masks to unlock their iPhones. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a letter obtained by the AP, MTA Chairman Patrick Foye <a href="https://apnews.com/73ea27104f60969bc223259b1460c5fd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked Apple CEO Tim Cook</a> to put plans for a stroopwafel emoji on the backburner and please find a simpler way for masked iPhone users to unlock their devices. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple spent years turning people's faces into a digital key, but now that feature is a public health risk. In May, Apple <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/20/21265019/apple-ios-13-5-out-now-unlock-iphone-face-mask-id-exposure-notification-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a software update that lets users enter their passcode immediately if Face ID detects a mask. But Foye says riders are still breaking mask requirements to unlock their phones.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>MTA ridership, which plummeted 90% when the pandemic started, has ticked back up to 20% of pre-pandemic levels. Early data out of Europe and Asia suggests public transportation <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/02/nyregion/nyc-subway-coronavirus-safety.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">isn't linked</a> to notable superspreader events and is safer than people think. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ If you're having trouble unlocking your phone in public, you can always <a href="https://faceidmasks.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">try these</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTravel is light years away from pre-pandemic levels, but it is slowly creeping back. Here's the latest: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. Planes\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTom Hanks finally has some company—U.S. airports are the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/10/airline-shares-surge-as-tsa-numbers-hit-pandemic-high-support-for-second-bailout-builds.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebusiest\u003c/a\u003e they've been in five months. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, TSA said it screened nearly 832,000 people at airport checkpoints on Sunday, the first time screenings have topped 800k since March 17. Air passenger levels remain around 70% lower than a year ago, however.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAirline execs have become full-time C-SPAN viewers. If Congress ever passes another COVID-19 relief bill, it could include more bailout funds for the industry.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrend watching: \u003c/strong\u003eTSA said it's finding guns in passenger carry-ons at \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/946144114ed44e83ba12858cba2334cd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e3x the pace\u003c/a\u003e it was at this time last year. And 80% of those guns were loaded.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. Hotels\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"We see folks are increasingly willing to step out and travel,\" Marriott CEO Arne Sorenson said during his company's \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/marriott-swings-to-2q-loss-cites-recovery-11597059791?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eQ2 earnings report\u003c/a\u003e, aka \"the worst quarter we have ever seen by far.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut by definition \"worst\" means \"can only get better.\" 91% of Marriott's global properties are now open, with Greater China leading the charge. Sorenson said that region's success is an example of what can happen if places successfully control the spread of the virus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrend watching: \u003c/strong\u003eIn terms of pace of recovery, leisure travel \u003e corporate travel, Sorenson said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. Cruises\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey say be your own best advocate, and Royal Caribbean execs are a shining example. CEO Richard Fain said the company was \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/10/royal-caribbean-stock-jumps-as-executives-tout-remarkable-demand-for-2021-cruises.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehumbled and surprised\u003c/a\u003e\" with 2021 bookings despite \"literally no marketing efforts.\" He said people were frustrated with staying at home and desperately wanted a vacation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe entire cruise industry has effectively been shut down since the pandemic gained steam in March. Royal Caribbean was forced to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/cruises/2020/08/10/royal-caribbean-cruises-likely-have-covid-19-testing-upon-return/3302471001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecancel\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e more than 1,500 sailings and booked a $1.3 billion loss last quarter.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrend watching: \u003c/strong\u003eExpect Royal Caribbean cruises to begin in Australia and China first, potentially before November. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the country’s largest mall landlord Simon Property Group reported earnings. You know what’s next. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRevenue declined 24% to $1.1 billion. To put some of the punches in perspective...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRent: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSimon \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://investors.simon.com/news-releases/news-release-details/simon-property-group-reports-second-quarter-2020-results?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollected\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 51% of the rent it was due in April and May in the U.S. Rent payments rebounded to ~70% in June and July.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCOVID-19 closures:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Simon’s U.S. retail properties lost a total 10,500 shopping days in Q2. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSimon’s been steadily reopening locations since lockdowns eased in May. As of Friday, 91% of its U.S. tenants were open and operating.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat’s not what got investors excited \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSunday, the WSJ reported Simon is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-and-giant-mall-operator-look-at-turning-sears-j-c-penney-stores-into-fulfillment-centers-11596992863?mod=e2tw\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein talks\u003c/a\u003e with Amazon to turn some mall properties occupied by struggling retailers like JCPenney and Sears into fulfillment centers. Why does that make sense?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSimon\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e gets a reliable tenant that definitely has money to make rent.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAmazon \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003egets more distribution centers across America to make good on its lightning-quick delivery promises.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e The collapse of brick-and-mortar shopping chains was called the “retail apocalypse” before COVID-19 hit. Mall owners have to get creative to stay alive, and e-commerce might be the answer.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile everyone was busy gambling on Ukrainian ping pong and Hertz stock, billionaire media mogul Barry Diller's IAC group was lining up a bet...on betting. Yesterday, IAC revealed a \u003ca href=\"https://skift.com/2020/08/10/barry-dillers-iac-takes-1-billion-stake-in-mgm-resorts-with-eye-on-online-gaming/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e12% stake\u003c/a\u003e in casino operator MGM Resorts worth an estimated $1 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTo Diller, MGM = Disney\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a letter to investors, Diller compared MGM—which operates Vegas casinos like the Bellagio and Mirage—to Disney for \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/a799a5e8-0c72-4214-b08d-cc6d3e01c5bd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eits ability\u003c/a\u003e to use its \"iconic brand and multiple avenues to monetize the same intellectual property.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne monetization avenue that most interests IAC is MGM's inroads in online gaming, which includes sports betting platform BetMGM. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt's only live in seven states so far due to restrictions on gambling, but Diller thinks that the regulatory environment will \"generally catch up with consumer demand,\" putting IAC in a position to profit when it does. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out\u003c/strong\u003e: The pandemic crippled the casino business, and revenue at MGM, which operates more than 35% of rooms on the Vegas strip, fell 91% in Q2. But if IAC's hunch is correct, there's a path to recovery for gaming companies—and it's through diversifying physical assets with more online offerings.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe country's largest public transit authority, New York City’s MTA, has a problem: Riders are taking off their masks to unlock their iPhones. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a letter obtained by the AP, MTA Chairman Patrick Foye \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/73ea27104f60969bc223259b1460c5fd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easked Apple CEO Tim Cook\u003c/a\u003e to put plans for a stroopwafel emoji on the backburner and please find a simpler way for masked iPhone users to unlock their devices. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple spent years turning people's faces into a digital key, but now that feature is a public health risk. In May, Apple \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/20/21265019/apple-ios-13-5-out-now-unlock-iphone-face-mask-id-exposure-notification-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e a software update that lets users enter their passcode immediately if Face ID detects a mask. But Foye says riders are still breaking mask requirements to unlock their phones.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eMTA ridership, which plummeted 90% when the pandemic started, has ticked back up to 20% of pre-pandemic levels. Early data out of Europe and Asia suggests public transportation \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/02/nyregion/nyc-subway-coronavirus-safety.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eisn't linked\u003c/a\u003e to notable superspreader events and is safer than people think. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ If you're having trouble unlocking your phone in public, you can always \u003ca href=\"https://faceidmasks.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etry
